result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry L Licona Curiel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jerry L Licona Curiel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jerry L Licona Curiel was found guilty of 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Pay restitution, the amount of which is to be determined within 30 days.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
No contact direct or indirect with victim and her family, except incidental contact at school.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample. Register as sex offender.

timeConds.notes: 6 months of sentence are stayed to be used at discretion of Court through Petition by Dept. of Corrections. Huber privileges granted. Report by January 10, 2016.
Perform 20 hours of uncompensated community service with non-profit agency.

Defendant Jerry L Licona Curiel in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, receipt of PSI, recommendation contained therein. No corrections to PSI. State/Defense make sentencing recommendations (joint except jail). Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Jerry L Licona Curiel in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews amendment of charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. Discussion regarding deportation. Counts 2, 3 are dismissed. Court orders PSI. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Interpreter Reme Bashi confirmed availability for 10:00 hearing via e-mail.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-20-2015 10:00 am
Jury trial at 08-31-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Jerry L Licona Curiel in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that case will proceed to trial. State advises of additional counts that will be filed, will likely be amending this case. Defense does not know if pretrial motions will be filed until he sees amended complaint. Court advises of conflict with jury trial date. Discussion regarding possible new jury dates. Pretrial motions due by August 7.

Pre-trial conference at 07-27-2015 03:30 pm.
Jury trial at 09-16-2015 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerry L Licona Curiel in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that he is continuing research into immigration issues, requests that case be set for trial. State has no objection. Set for 2 day trial prior to Sept. 1 with pretrial last Monday in July. Bond continues as is.

Defendant Jerry L Licona Curiel in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests additional 30 days for negotiations, is investigating immigration issues.  Status conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty plea. Status conference set for 2/27/15, 10:30.
by State

Defendant Jerry L Licona Curiel appeared by video conference. Attorney Victor Dana Brooks appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 11/10/14, 10:00.
